results.title: Congenital broncho-oesophageal fistula in an adult
results.creator_credit: Francois Seguillon, ONF | NFB, Jean Roy and Claudia Overing
results.brief_description: This is a film record of a surgical operation, performed in a Montreal hospital in December, 1968, to correct a rare congenital anomaly in a sixty-six year old male - a case in which there was a fistula between the normal oesophagus and a bronchial segment. A report of this case was published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal, May 9, 1970, v. 102.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francois Seguillon, ONF | NFB, Jean Roy and Claudia Overing

results.title: Confusion: diagnosis and management
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
One in a series about techniques for the management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This episode looks in some detail, at the various causes of acute confusion, outlining the basic principles of treatment.

results.title: Confusion
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
An elderly woman is found ill and confused by her neighbour. We follow the process of hospital admission through her eyes. The film stresses the importance of correct initial diagnosis and the importance of sympathetic attitudes from medical staff.

results.title: Confucianism and the Taiwan experience
results.creator_credit: Wu Li-Ching and Kwang Hwa Mass Communications
results.brief_description: Confucianism focuses on diligence, thrift, harmony and love of learning. This documentary looks at how the people of Taiwan have taken these values to heart in the economic rebuilding of their country. Modern Taiwan is drawing on the spirit of Confucianism for inspiration as the republic progresses towards the 21st Ccentury.

results.title: Confucianism and Taoism
results.brief_description: The religious traditions of Confucianism and Taoism have influenced the lives of billions of people in China and around the world. Confucianism shapes the spiritual and ethical considerations of its followers, while Taoism stresses a harmony with nature and the life force within one’s self. This video, narrated by Ben Kingsley, describes the life of Confucius and how his philosophy and social doctrine have influenced Chinese culture. It also investigates the world of Taoism - its philosophy and its rituals.

results.title: Confrontation: a nurse and an addict
results.creator_credit: Peter Schnitzler and Extension Media Center, University of California
results.brief_description: Poses questions regarding the professionals’ approach toward drug users. Demonstrates the conflict that arises between a white middle class nurse and a drug addict from a ghetto in hospital on a methadone program.

results.title: Conformity, obedience and dissent
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill, Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Scientific experiments have consistently revealed how difficult it is for the individual to dissent or disobey within Western society. This video examines the psychological and social phenomena of conformity, obedience and dissent, using interviews with prominent US psychologists and referring to landmark experiments on obedience such as that conducted by Stanley Milgram. In this experiment, two-thirds of subjects applied increasingly powerful electric shocks as punishment simply because an authority figure told them to do so.
